title: Just-In-Time & Just-Enough Admin Implementation
subtitle: Precision privilege delivery for secure operations
learning_objectives: Design JIT/JEA workflows aligned with AD security strategy
Configure Azure AD PIM and on-premises JIT tooling
Author JEA role capability files for administrative tasks
Integrate JIT requests with privileged workstation policies
Monitor and alert on privileged session activity
Document break-glass and rollback procedures for elevated access

content_blocks.title: JIT-JEA Steps

content.text:
### PLAN
1. **Prepare** role definitions.
2. **Limit** elevation duration.
3. **Approve** via automated workflow.
4. **Notify** and monitor sessions.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Condense the lesson into an easy-to-recall mnemonic.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Analysts lean on mnemonics to brief stakeholders quickly.

content.text: A financial institution combined Azure AD PIM with on-premises JEA to reduce standing admins by 85%, improving audit outcomes and minimising lateral movement opportunities.

content_blocks.title: Guided Simulation

content.text:
1. Identify two administrative tasks in your lab.
2. Create JEA role capability files permitting only required cmdlets.
3. Configure time-bound access using Azure AD PIM or AD scripts.
4. Test elevation, monitor logs, and document rollback steps.

content_blocks.simplified_explanation: Rehearse in a safe environment before applying to production.
content_blocks.real_world_connection: Dry runs reveal gaps before live execution.
